meanings.definition: The vertical side of a doorway or window frame.
meanings.sent1: She leaned against the jamb of the door.
meanings.sent2: The painter carefully painted the wooden jamb of the window.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to climb the jamb but slipped comically.
meanings.sent4: His words hit her heart like a heavy jamb against a wall.
meanings.sent5: The jamb stood tall and sturdy, framing the entrance beautifully.

meanings.definition: A projecting mass or column forming a part of a wall.
meanings.sent1: The ancient castle had thick stone jambs supporting its walls.
meanings.sent2: The jamb of the building was adorned with intricate carvings.
meanings.sent3: The vines grew around the jamb, making it look like a natural pillar.
meanings.sent4: The jamb loomed over them like a protective giant.
meanings.sent5: The jamb added strength and character to the structure.

meanings.definition: To press or squeeze something against a surface.
meanings.sent1: She had to jamb the suitcase into the overhead compartment.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally jambmed his finger in the car door.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to jamb the dough to make it flat.
meanings.sent4: The crowd started to jamb against the barricades, eager to get closer.
meanings.sent5: The students had to jamb their notes into their backpacks before the bell rang.
